Name: Achnashellach Forest
Description: Achnashellach Forest does not have recreational facilities that many other Forestry Commission forests have . It is in a remote part of the Scottish Highlands and is fairly mountainous . The Forest was originally part of a Caledonian Forest

Name: Argyll Forest Park
Description: In 1935 , Argyll Forest became the first Forest Park in Britain . It lies on the border between the Scottish Highlands and the Scottish Lowlands

Name: Craik Forest
Description: Craik Forest is primarily a commercial forest with timber being processed at facilities nearby . There are some recreational facilities within the forest

Name: Dalbeattie Forest
Description: Dalbeattie Forest has primarily been a commercial forest , though the Forestry Commission has worked with local organisations to expand recreational facilities . The forest now hosts one of the 7stanes biking trails

Name: Forest of Ae
Description: Ae was created by the Forestry Commission soon after it was established . While it is mainly a commercial forest , it is also one of the 7stanes forests

Name: Galloway Forest Park
Description: Galloway Forest is the largest forest in Britain . In 2009 it became the first Dark Sky Park in the UK

Name: Garscadden Wood
Description: Garscadden Wood lies within the Drumchapel Woodlands , slightly north west of Glasgow

Name: Glen Affric
Description: Glen Affric is home to a large area of Caledonian Forest and is designated a National Nature Reserve

Name: Glencoe Lochan
Description: Glencoe Lochan forest was established by 1st Baron Strathcona in the 19th century . It is a coniferous forest

Name: Glenmore Forest Park
Description: Genmore contains some caledoninan woodland . It became the second Forest Park to be created by the Commission in 1948

Name: Knapdale Forest
Description: Knapdale has a colony of beavers as part of the Scottish Beaver Trial

Name: Mabie Forest
Description: Mabie Forest has been owned by the Forestry Commission since 1943 . It has become a recreational forest , with walking routes and 7stanes biking trails

Name: Queen Elizabeth Forest Park
Description: The Queen Elizabeth Forest Park consists of several forests . It became a forest park in 1953 as part of the coronation of Queen Elizabeth II

Name: Tay Forest Park
Description: The Tay Forest Park is made up of several different forests . The forest has been visited by several royals , including Queen Victoria and Queen Isabella of Scotland

Name: Tweed Valley Forest Park
Description: The Tweed Valley Forest Park is made up of seven forests around the Scottish Borders . Glentress and Innerleithen forests are part of the 7stanes biking trail project
